title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

10:05 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: the mail you sent is speaking about 3.2M2 in the title and the list of the release note  
10:05 <+tmortagne> but the description is about RC1  
10:05 <@sdumitriu> 3.2 or 3.1?  
10:06 <+tmortagne> yes 3.1  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Too much reuse...  
10:06 <+tmortagne> anyway it's a title about M2 for a RC1 release  
10:06 <@sdumitriu> Copy/pasting only works if you're careful not to leave old stuff  
10:08 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:10 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki

10:13 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki

10:17 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: shouldn't we remove the  xwiki-platform frok from xwiki-contrib ?  
10:17 <+tmortagne> \*fork  
10:19 <j-saturne> has quit  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> Yep, if nobody is using it  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> I was hoping that GSoC students could commit in it, but it's simpler if they use their own fork and make pull requests  
10:21 <@sdumitriu> Still waiting to see some commits from GSoC  
10:22 <+tmortagne> yea me too  
10:22 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: If you have some good contrib candidates to move, tell me  
10:22 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I was thinking about authenticator but I don't know if they should be in the same repository or not  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> Probably not  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> They're not supposed to be used together  
10:23 <@sdumitriu> And I think they have their own trunk/tags, combining them would be harder  
10:23 <+tmortagne> yes technically I agree but as example it was good to have them grouped somewhere  
10:24 <+tmortagne> would be cool we we good do some kind of group of repositories in an organization  
10:24 <+tmortagne> s/we we good/if we could/  
10:25 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning. I doubt this is true: "No APIs were modified since XWiki Enterprise 3.0." at http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise31RC1  
10:25 <vmassol> could you confirm?  
10:25 <+tmortagne> or we start to list them explicitely in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication which is probably a good thing anyway  
10:25 <vmassol> (maybe it is)  
10:25 <+tmortagne> vmassol: same for me a really doubt that  
10:25 <+tmortagne> I'm pretty sure I remember having to put some clirr excludes  
10:27 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:30 <+tmortagne> hmm actually there is indeed only  
10:30 <+tmortagne> <exclude>com/xpn/xwiki/pref/api/XWikiPrefService</exclude>  
10:30 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <@sdumitriu> Opening http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Blog/BlogIntroduction results in 1404 SQL queries sent to the database...  
10:33 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:33 <@sdumitriu> Second load of that page: 14 queries  
10:34 <@sdumitriu> Caching works  
10:34 <@sdumitriu> But it's still a lot  
10:35 <@sdumitriu> Hm, from those 1404 queries, 48 are uniq  
10:36 <vmassol> wow 1400 queries  
10:36 <vmassol> we have a problem…. that's way too much  
10:38 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
10:43 <@cjdelisle> I commented out that <exclude> and mvn clean install runs fine  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> wow I managed to break everything this time around  
10:44 <@cjdelisle> even the mail  
10:44 <@sdumitriu> :)  
10:46 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <@cjdelisle> can someone with the passwords do wikimatrix and freshmeat for me?  
10:49 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
10:49 <vmassol> (in a meeting btw)  
10:49 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
10:51 <+tmortagne> I don't think you need special password for freshmeat  
10:51 <j-saturne> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Does this work for you? http://freshmeat.net/projects/xwiki/releases/new  
10:52 <+tmortagne> just create an account on freshmeat  
10:52 <+tmortagne> and we can add you to the XWiki project  
10:52 <@sdumitriu> Done wikimatrix  
10:52 <+tmortagne> or you request to be part of XWiki project I don't remember  
10:52 <+tmortagne> checking  
10:53 <+tmortagne> but I don't have admin right on XWiki project it seems  
10:54 <+tmortagne> not even sure you need to request anything actually  
10:55 <+tmortagne> just need an account and freshmeat guys will verify what you sendd anyway  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> Me neither  
10:55 <@sdumitriu> Asking Ludo, once he's out of the meeting  
10:57 <+tmortagne> anyway I don't think it's needed for a release  
10:57 <@sdumitriu> But I think you can submit news without being a member of the project  
11:02 <@cjdelisle> http://freshmeat.net/users/CalebJamesDeLisle

12:51 <vmassol> cjdelisle: isn't this nice:  
12:51 <vmassol>         getUtil().gotoPage("BreadcrumbsTest", "testBreadcrumbsParentPage", "objectadd",  
12:51 <vmassol>             "classname=XWiki.XWikiRights&XWiki.XWikiRights\_levels=view&XWiki.XWikiRights\_users=Administrator");  
12:52 <abusenius> has quit  
12:52 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: &XWIKI.XWikiRights\_allow=1  
12:52 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: &XWiki.XWikiRights\_allow=1  
12:52 <vmassol> sdumitriu: why is it needed?  
12:52 <vmassol> (it's the default)  
12:53 <@sdumitriu> Is it?  
12:53 <@sdumitriu> I doubt it works  
12:53 <@sdumitriu> Let me test  
12:53 <vmassol> I tested  
12:54 <@sdumitriu> How?  
12:54 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <vmassol> (of course :))  
12:54 <vmassol> both manually and in BreadcrumbsTest  
12:54 <@sdumitriu> By the way, shouldn't it be XWiki.Administrator instead of Administrator?  
12:55 <@sdumitriu> No, actually XWiki.Admin  
12:55 <vmassol> the listbox says Administrator  
12:55 <vmassol> and that works  
12:55 <@sdumitriu> The listbox displays Administrator  
12:55 <vmassol> again I tested and it works  
12:55 <@sdumitriu> I don't trust you  
12:56 <@sdumitriu> Ah, wait  
12:56 <@sdumitriu> objectadd works correctly  
12:56 <@sdumitriu> Using the API to add the object doesn;t  
12:56 <vmassol> btw I wasn't asking a question....  
12:56 <vmassol> I'm sure of what I did  
12:56 <vmassol> was just pinging cjdelisle  
12:56 <@sdumitriu> Or not...  
12:56 <@sdumitriu> The object looks wrong  
12:57 <@sdumitriu> No, that can't work  
12:57 <@sdumitriu> It's not how XWiki works  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> Open  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/objectadd/Sandbox/r?classname=XWiki.XWikiRights&XWiki.XWikiRights\_levels=view&XWiki.XWikiRights\_users=Administrator  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> Then look at the rights editor:  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/edit/Sandbox/r?editor=rights  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> Or at the XML:  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/Sandbox/r?xpage=xml  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> The object is not correct  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> The user is not the right one  
12:58 <@sdumitriu> And allow is not set at all  
12:59 <@sdumitriu> It's missing a value  
12:59 <@sdumitriu> It "looks" OK if you look in the object editor  
13:00 <+tmortagne> indeed I really hope this request does not work with "Administrator" since  that user does not exist or it's a very very bad design to use display name at this level  
13:00 <@sdumitriu> "allow" is selected because there's no "nothing" value, and a dropdown select must have something selected  
13:01 <vmassol> BreadcrumbsTest works fine  
13:01 <@sdumitriu> Because you're Admin anyway  
13:01 <@sdumitriu> Actually no  
13:01 <@sdumitriu> Admin sees that because he has administrator privileges, view can't be denied anyway  
13:02 <vmassol> BreadcrumbsTest logs out  
13:02 <@sdumitriu> The other user doesn't have access not because Admin has, but because there is a Rights object  
13:02 <@sdumitriu> It's a false positive  
13:02 <+tmortagne> yep  
13:02 <@sdumitriu> It works because the complex way rights are handled  
13:02 <@sdumitriu> Not because you set the correct rights  
13:02 <@sdumitriu> You can try not with Administrator, but with Ana and Bob  
13:03 <vmassol> ok testing iwth XWiki.Admin  
13:03 <@sdumitriu> Try to set the rights for Ana and see if Ana has view rights  
13:03 <@sdumitriu> I bet 2 euros she doesn't  
13:03 <+tmortagne> we even used to have the exact same mistake in XE xar itself long time ago  
13:03 <+tmortagne> some bad user was used instead of XWiki.Admin to protect XWiki space  
13:04 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:04 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Also add XWiki.XWikiRights\_allow=1  
13:12 <vmassol> sdumitriu: done thanks  
13:12 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:20 <vmassol> hmm did I break something yesterday in the testin fwk...?  
13:21 <vmassol> I see lots of tests with this: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/736/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui/EditInlineTest/testInlineEditPreservesTags/  
13:21 <vmassol> indeed  
13:21 <vmassol> fixing  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Yep, saw that last night  
13:25 <@sdumitriu> Endless loop  
13:26 <vmassol> fixed  
13:26 <vmassol> my bad

13:29 <@cjdelisle> back  
13:29 <@cjdelisle> yes, I like that solution (however the semantics work out)  
13:30 <@cjdelisle> and yes, the coffee was very good.  
13:30 <vmassol> hope it doesn't flicker anymore….  
13:30 <vmassol> skype is dead btw  
13:30 <@cjdelisle> skype is dead, long live irc  
13:31 <vmassol> :)  
13:31 <@cjdelisle> mine's working, sounds like a network fragmentation  
13:32 <vmassol> cjdelisle: we need to work on a strategy for fixing ignored tests too  
13:33 <vmassol> it's good to quarantine tests but we need a strategy to unquarantine them  
13:33 <@cjdelisle> Yes, all of my @Ignored tests have the string "@Ignore" in them (even if they are junit3 and it needed to be in a comment)  
13:33 <vmassol> hmm seems we have only 2 quarantined in ui tests  
13:33 <vmassol> the only remaining one now is AddRemoveTagsTest  
13:33 <vmassol> testTagCaseIsIgnored to be precise  
13:34 <vmassol> ok another one in storage tests  
13:34 <@cjdelisle> I was thinking of sending out mail and asking who wants to claim them.  
13:34 <vmassol> and 2 in wysiwyg tests  
13:34 <vmassol> mflorea already claimed those AFAIK  
13:35 <+mflorea> yes  
13:35 <@cjdelisle> We also have more flickers so we to quarentine more tests  
13:35 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:35 <vmassol> I see this new one from yesterday http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/736/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest/testCreateAndDeleteGroup/  
13:35 <+mflorea> and there are still 4 flickering tests that I'll handle asap  
13:35 <@cjdelisle> And unfortunately I will be quite unavailable as soon as this release completes.  
13:35 <vmassol> this one too mflorea http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/736/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/TabsTest/testSwitchToSourceWithoutHTMLChanges/  
13:36 <+mflorea> yes, one of those 4  
13:36 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: do you have a minute?  
13:36 <jvelociter> has quit  
13:36 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:36 <+sburjan> when is 3.0.1 to be released.. have we decided a date ?  
13:36 <vmassol> checking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/736/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/UsersGroupsRightsManagementTest/testCreateAndDeleteGroup/  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Can it wait?  
13:37 <+mflorea> 45min?  
13:37 <vmassol> who can claim testTagCaseIsIgnored?  
13:37 <+mflorea> me  
13:38 <vmassol> ok thanks  
13:38 <+mflorea> link?  
13:38 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki

13:38 <vmassol> the tests needs to be fixed and @ignored removed  
13:39 <vmassol> let me find the jira  
13:39 <+mflorea> ok, but is there a jira issue opened?  
13:39 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-948

13:59 <vmassol> sburjan: was it you converted VersionTest to selenium2?  
13:59 <+sburjan> yes  
13:59 <vmassol> it seems it wasn't removed from sel1  
13:59 <vmassol> any reason?  
13:59 <vmassol> (btw I'm moving it out of history package)  
14:00 <+sburjan> wait, let me look  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> http://xwiki.pastebay.com/125356  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> list of @Ignores  
14:00 <vmassol> cjdelisle: do a git pull ;)  
14:01 <vmassol> one has been removed  
14:01 <vmassol> btw tmortagne, WikiManagementCreate has a bad name for a test case  
14:01 <@cjdelisle> platform is already up to date  
14:01 <@cjdelisle> ahh enterprise, got it  
14:02 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep  
14:03 <+sburjan> vmassol: seems you are right. you can remove that.  
14:03 <vmassol> ok doing it  
14:03 <+sburjan> also checkd on my fork and I also have it  
14:05 <+sburjan> vmassol: it seems I removed Version test from AllTests from Se1, but I forgot to remove the class  
14:05 <+tmortagne> ( vmassol: fixed )  
14:06 <vmassol> sburjan: I don't understadn why we have HistoryTab.loadHistoryTab  
14:06 <vmassol> It seems to me that on ViewPage we should be able to open the history tab  
14:06 <vmassol> HistoryTab historyTab = vp.openHistoryDocExtraPane();  
14:07 <vmassol> hmmm I think it's a name issue  
14:07 <vmassol> it's not the history tab but the history page  
14:07 <+sburjan> i know what you are talking about, yes. tehre are 2 ways  
14:07 <vmassol> no  
14:07 <vmassol> unless i don't understand sthing  
14:07 <+sburjan> either from viewPage, and the other from the PaneClass  
14:08 <vmassol> I think what you called loadHistoryTab actually opens the history page  
14:08 <vmassol> the history tab is the history tab at the bottom of pages  
14:08 <+sburjan> no no.. Pane == Tab  
14:08 <vmassol> there's no pane  
14:09 <+sburjan> it's a naming issue  
14:09 <vmassol> only tab and page  
14:09 <+sburjan> some are called Panes some are called Tabs  
14:09 <vmassol> I also don't undertand why you need to go to the page  
14:09 <vmassol> and why clicking on the history is not enough for the test  
14:09 <vmassol> unless you want to test that the history page works  
14:09 <+sburjan> could you give me the link to the test you are looking at ?  
14:10 <vmassol> (but that isn't clear at all in the test)  
14:10 <vmassol> VersionTest  
14:10 <+sburjan> let me take a look  
14:12 <vmassol> I'm fixing the test  
14:13 <+sburjan> it's failing ?  
14:13 <vmassol> no  
14:13 <vmassol> but it's not correct  
14:13 <vmassol> take much longer than needed  
14:13 <vmassol> hard to understand  
14:14 <+sburjan> i click on the bottom link .. to open the history  
14:14 <+sburjan> and then I wait for the pane to be loaded  
14:14 <vmassol> why?  
14:14 <+sburjan> it's async and non blocking state.. and I might click something that isn't loaded/visible/there yet  
14:14 <vmassol> why do you click on the bottom link?  
14:16 <vmassol> shouldn't rollbackToversion return a ViewPage?  
14:16 <vmassol> I think it should  
14:23 <vmassol> sburjan: btw your tests didn't verify the page contnet  
14:23 <vmassol> I added the verification  
14:24 <vmassol> (as it used to be in sel1)  
14:24 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <vmassol> sburjan: just pushed it, could you have a look?  
14:26 <vmassol> (and tell me if you prefer it or not)  
14:26 <vmassol> there are lots of subtle things I improved  
14:27 <vmassol> like createPage returns a ViewPage  
14:27 <vmassol> and there's no need to goto the page again since you're already on it  
14:27 <vmassol> that saves an extra call in term of test execeution  
14:28 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
14:29 <vmassol> hmmm  
14:29 <vmassol> loadHistoryTab() doesn't return anything  
14:29 <vmassol> that's not normal  
14:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: did you review that test?  
14:31 <vmassol> s/test/commit/  
14:32 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Which one?  
14:32 <vmassol> VersionTest and related classes  
14:33 <vmassol> they have lots of issues  
14:33 <vmassol> I've fixed a few  
14:33 <vmassol> fixing others now  
14:33 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
14:33 <vmassol> it's absolutly not following the PageObject strategy for ex  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> should this be merged with trunk? https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/7f5c88d685c233eef6284397f18586c81d65ff76  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> I'm hesitent because there were no translations at the time of the branch.  
14:34 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Yes  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> ok  
14:34 <@cjdelisle> thanks  
14:34 <@sdumitriu> Wait  
14:34 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <@sdumitriu> Hm, I think not  
14:35 <@sdumitriu> Those were removed, and they shouldn't be brought back  
14:35 <@sdumitriu> Let me check something  
14:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: Those shouldn't exist anymore  
14:36 <@sdumitriu> They should be Main.Welcome instead of Main.WebHome  
14:36 <@cjdelisle> hmm well they do exist on l10n and they were released.  
14:38 <@sdumitriu> Something to fix in RC2  
14:38 <vmassol> sburjan: when we were talking earlier I thought there was a link in the history tab leading to this page: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?viewer=history  
14:39 <vmassol> and that's what you were talking about clicking the history link  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> do they break anything?  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> No  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> Actually, yes  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> They don't have the same document structure  
14:39 <vmassol> sburjan: I've removed the method.  
14:39 <@sdumitriu> Now Main.WebHome is no longer a dashboard in translations  
14:40 <@cjdelisle> How long is that going to take to fix?  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> lucaa won't be happy  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: The proper fix would be to update the translations on l10n  
14:40 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>  
14:40 <@sdumitriu> As in, add a new resource for Main.Welcome  
14:41 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do we have any UI link that leads to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?viewer=history now?  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> Copy translations  
14:41 <@sdumitriu> Remove the Main.WebHome resource
